title: Understanding the CCPA
text: The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) is a significant piece of legislation that aims to enhance privacy rights and consumer protection for residents of California. Consider what rights it grants to consumers and what obligations it imposes on businesses.

title: Consumer Rights Under CCPA
text: Think about the types of rights the CCPA might grant to consumers. These could include the right to know what personal data is being collected, the right to delete personal data, and the right to opt-out of the sale of personal data.

title: Business Obligations Under CCPA
text: Consider the obligations that businesses might have under the CCPA. These could involve providing transparency about data collection practices, ensuring data security, and respecting consumer requests regarding their personal data.

title: Evaluating the Statement
text: Reflect on whether the CCPA indeed creates a framework of rights and obligations related to personal information. Does the act focus on consumer privacy and data protection?
